Re: Protest in Blue Jay

The Rim of the World Unified School District is committed to providing an educational environment that promotes the safety of students, staff, and visitors to school and district grounds. The District also recognizes the importance of protecting district property, facilities, and equipment from vandalism and theft. The District has been notified that a protest will occur in the city of Blue Jay on Friday, June 5, 2020. As such, the District prohibits the assembly of persons for the purpose of protesting on any District property. However, there is a recognition that people have a First Amendment Right to peacefully assemble on public property, such as the sidewalk. The District has been coordinating with the County Sheriff’s Department to address concerns related to the protest in close vicinity of the District Office. We sincerely hope for a calm, peaceful, and safe event on Friday.

Everyday teachers and staff are dedicated to improving the educational experience for our students and we are proud of the work they are doing.

Mr. Nygren was fortunate to be able to travel to Mammoth this week with the Rim Ski and Snowboard Team, otherwise known as the Shred Team. “It is a great way to reward our students at the end of the week for working hard, being safe, responsible and respectful. It just makes for a fun time and everyone looks forward to it,” said Principal Veronica McGilvery.

Third graders Charlotte and Emma said they look forward to Fridays. They want to dance, request their favorite songs and have fun with friends.

Fun Fridays are here to stay at LAE! Come out and dance with us!
